name: Slash Command Discovery
description: Shows how typing /dev auto-suggests popkit:dev without needing the full popkit: prefix

screenshots.description: User types '/' character - cursor ready for command

screenshots.notes: Dropdown shows all matching commands including popkit:dev

screenshots.description: Dropdown visible with popkit:dev as first match (highlighted)
screenshots.notes: Key insight: semantic search puts popkit:dev first, even without 'popkit:' prefix
Tab key accepts the highlighted suggestion

screenshots.description: User continues typing ' work' after command

key_insights: No need to type full 'popkit:' prefix - saves 7 keystrokes
Semantic search finds popkit:dev from just 'dev' - smart matching
Tab completion works instantly - familiar UX
Works for all Claude Code plugins, not just PopKit - universal pattern
Only need to type first few letters of actual command name
vhs_limitations: VHS cannot show actual dropdown menus from Claude Code UI
Recommend using annotated screenshot instead for this demo
Alternative: simulate dropdown in terminal using ASCII art (less accurate)

alternative_approaches.name: Hybrid approach
pros: Screenshot for dropdown, VHS for execution
